name: Fear Of A Black Planet Action Figure
description:
Released in 1990, “Fear of a Black Planet” is the third studio album of militant rap group Public Enemy. Coming nearly two years after their landmark sophomore LP, “It Takes a Nation of Millions to Hold Us Back”, the album is regarded by many to be a pinnacle of political hip hop. Propelled by the production wizardry of The Bomb Squad (Chuck D, Eric Sadler, Keith and Hank Shocklee), it was an explosive hour-long barrage of multi-layered samples and thunderous break-beats. 

Arguably the loudest and most chaotic rap album of its time, “Fear of a Black Planet” still resonates as powerfully today as it did 32 years ago. It features iconic provocative lines that have had a cultural impact that’s gone beyond just lyrics and entered the cultural landscape of grass-root resistance. This is an album that took the concept of violently tearing down the power structure status-quo, and pair it with the HARDEST production anyone could possibly made at the time. While it might not be Public Enemy’s best work, it’s among the greatest hip hop albums ever released.    
 
Card is made from Fear Of A Black Planet cover art.

Figure is made from repainted Hasbro’s Black Series Stormtrooper figure, repainted Legacy Collection Princess Leia figure, and Ed Piskor’s Public Enemy S1W figure.
